title: The Brothers Return with Benjamin
summary: Genesis 43 continues the story as the brothers return to Egypt with Benjamin. Joseph welcomes them warmly and hosts a feast, but still keeps his identity hidden.

faq.question: Why was Jacob hesitant to send Benjamin?
faq.answer: Benjamin was Rachel’s last surviving son, and Jacob feared losing him too.

faq.question: How did Joseph treat the brothers during the feast?
faq.answer: He showed special favor to Benjamin, giving him five times as much food.

faq.question: Why did Benjamin get five times more food than his brothers?
faq.answer: Giving someone extra was a way to show special honor or favor. Joseph was showing love to Benjamin, his full brother, and maybe testing to see if the others would get jealous like they did years before with him.

faq.question: Why did the servant wash their feet?
faq.answer: Foot washing was a common custom in Bible times. People walked long distances in sandals, so it was polite and respectful to offer water or wash a guest’s feet when they arrived.

faq.question: Why did Joseph eat by himself?
faq.answer: As a ruler, Joseph ate separately out of respect for his high position. Important leaders often had their own table or dining area to show their status.

faq.question: Why did the Egyptians and Hebrews eat at different tables?
faq.answer: Egyptians believed it was wrong or offensive to eat with foreigners like Hebrews. In their culture, eating together meant closeness or equality, and they didn’t want to mix with people from different backgrounds.
